I asked if this ship would be on time charter to Caltex and he replied that his Company would prefer not to charter but to carry at so much per ton, as by this means they might be able to pick up a return cargo or cargo between intermediate ports. He explained that the vessel would have refrigerated space and if inducement offered might go as far south as Durban though he thought this unlikely. I said that we would be glad to act as Agents for the ship at Bahrain and Mr. Klein said that he thought his Company would prefer to open their own office here. When I remarked that this might not have the approval of the authorities, he said that he fully realised the political difficulties that might be involved but he had no doubt that ways and means could be found to overcome them. mods.abstract: The file contains a note from the Political Resident, Persian Gulf, addressed to the Political Agent, Bahrain. It is dated aboard the scheme yacht, King Faisal, 4 December 1946, and is forwarding a note by Messrs Gray Mackenzie, Bahrain dated 17 August, 1946.The note records a conversation with a Mr Klein who mentioned that his company had purchased two 5000 ton freighters: one to transport locomotives from the United States of America to France and the other to carry drums of gasoline from Bahrain to Red Sea ports and further down the East African coast. Also discussed are the potential political difficulties of opening an office in Bahrain and how this could be circumvented.
